thread.title: The Case for Responsible Nationalism

author: William A. Galston
title: The Case for Responsible Nationalism
text:
Last week President Trump moved toward imposing $60 billion in tariffs on Chinese imports. These actions, and the steel and aluminum tariffs announced earlier, are misguided. But that doesn’t mean the status quo is acceptable. Democrats and Republicans have long ignored the economic distortions caused by China’s irresponsible policies.

It didn’t have to be this way. More than two decades ago, Harvard economist Dani Rodrik warned that globalization was driving a wedge between workers who had the skills and mobility to prosper...
